title: Amazon KDP Professional Analyzing competitors step by step

tactics.name: Page Length Analysis
tactics.description: Evaluate competitor books' page counts to identify correlations with earnings
steps: Compare page length to sales performance
caveats: Page length alone doesn't guarantee success
source_quotes: a lot of very well performing books they all are 102 pages long

tactics.name: Price Point Optimization
tactics.description: Analyze competitor pricing strategies within niches
steps: Compare price points across top-performing books
caveats: Pricing must balance competitiveness and profitability
source_quotes: books that earn a lot they are between let's say 100 and 110 Pages

tactics.name: Dynamic Pricing Strategy
tactics.description: Start with a competitive price range and incrementally increase pricing based on sales performance to maximize earnings.
steps: Set initial price at the upper end of the competitor range (e.g., $7.99)
Increase price by $0.50 increments after consistent sales
Stop increasing when earnings per book start to decline
caveats: Price increases may reduce sales volume if overdone
source_quotes: I would just go with the highest of those which in my case would be 7.99

heuristics.name: Page Length Correlation
heuristics.condition: If median page length correlates with higher earnings, prioritize similar lengths
source_quotes: three books which have exactly the same amount of pages

heuristics.name: BSR Threshold Check
heuristics.condition: If the top book's BSR exceeds 10,000, the niche may have poor sales potential
source_quotes: the top book in that Niche has a bestseller rank of less than 10,000

claims.statement: Books around 102 pages demonstrate higher earnings potential in analyzed niches
source_quotes: three books which have exactly the same amount of pages

claims.statement: A niche's success is indicated by the top book's BSR being below 10,000
source_quotes: the top book in that Niche has a bestseller rank of less than 10,000

niche_patterns.description: Identify underserved sub-niches with specific constraints
niche_patterns.why_it_works: Targets niche markets with unmet needs
source_quotes: what we really do is we create a product that a customer wants to buy
